alert.note: Alert for Gogebic; Ontonagon (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 12 at 12:22AM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Gogebic and southwestern Ontonagon Counties through 115 AM EDT/1215 AM CDT/... At 1221 AM EDT/1121 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles west of Gurney to near Tomahawk. Movement was northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ironwood, Bessemer, Wakefield, Marenisco, Hurley, Watersmeet, Bergland, Paulding, Silver City, Norwich, Tamarack Lake, Presque Isle Reservoir, Pomeroy Lake, Lake Gogebic State Park, Clark Lake, Ewen, Thomaston, Little Girls Point, Van Buskirk and Copper Peak. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
